name: Test
body:
## Hello ggplot2.sparkR
SparkR requires no additional training for existing R users who are already familiar with ggplot2 and allows them to benefit from powerful distributed processing capabilities of Spark for efficient visualization of big data.

```R
ggplot(data, aes(x = Item, fill = Payment)) + geom_bar()
```

![image of bar chart](https://github.com/moonkyung/Test/tree/gh-pages/bar.png)

If the input data is Spark DataFrame, heavyweight data processing stages are offloaded to the Spark backend using the SparkR API.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
